Uses of Interface
org.hibernate.jpa.event.spi.CallbackRegistryConsumer

Packages that use CallbackRegistryConsumer
Package
Description
org.hibernate.event.internal
This package defines a default set of event listeners that implement the default behaviors of Hibernate session operations.

  • Uses of CallbackRegistryConsumer in org.hibernate.event.internal

    Classes in org.hibernate.event.internal that implement CallbackRegistryConsumer
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    class 
    AbstractSaveEventListener<C>
    A convenience base class for listeners responding to save events.
    class 
    DefaultDeleteEventListener
    Defines the default delete event listener used by hibernate for deleting entities from the datastore in response to generated delete events.
    class 
    DefaultFlushEntityEventListener
    An event that occurs for each entity instance at flush time
    class 
    DefaultMergeEventListener
    Defines the default copy event listener used by hibernate for copying entities in response to generated copy events.
    class 
    DefaultPersistEventListener
    Defines the default create event listener used by hibernate for creating transient entities in response to generated create events.
    class 
    DefaultPersistOnFlushEventListener
    When persist is used as the cascade action, persistOnFlush should be used
    class 
    DefaultPostLoadEventListener
    Performs needed EntityEntry.getLockMode()-related processing.
    class 
    DefaultReplicateEventListener
    Deprecated.
    since Session.replicate(java.lang.Object, org.hibernate.ReplicationMode) is deprecated
    class 
    PostDeleteEventListenerStandardImpl
    The standard PostDeleteEventListener implementation
    class 
    PostInsertEventListenerStandardImpl
     
    class 
    PostUpdateEventListenerStandardImpl
     
    class 
    PostUpsertEventListenerStandardImpl
    This is just a stub, since we don't yet have a @PostUpsert callback
